docs.snippet: With Albert Pujols most likely out for the season because of an injury, the Angels are learning a lesson the Yankees already know about 10-year contracts for aging stars....
docs.lead_paragraph: With Albert Pujols most likely out for the season because of an injury, the Angels are learning a lesson the Yankees already know about 10-year contracts for aging stars.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that with slugging first baseman Albert Pujols most likely out for the 2013 MLB season because of injury, Los Angeles Angels are learning a lesson the New York Yankees already know about 10-year contracts for aging stars; says that as the Yankees have learned with third baseman Alex Rodriguez, no player is special enough to defy age and produce at a high level for another decade.

headline.main: Angels Pay Heavy Price for Gamble on Pujols
headline.print_headline: Broken Batter | Angels Learning a Lesson the Yanks Already Know: Beware the 10-Year Deal

docs.snippet: As Major League Baseball prepares to issue a series of suspensions stemming from its investigation of an anti-aging clinic, Alex Rodriguez is planning to fight a potential punishment, his lawyer said....
docs.lead_paragraph: As Major League Baseball prepares to issue a series of suspensions stemming from its investigation of an anti-aging clinic, Alex Rodriguez is planning to fight a potential punishment, his lawyer said.
docs.abstract: Lawyer for New York Yankees third baseman Alex Rodriguez says that he is planning to fight a potential punishment stemming from Major League Baseball's investigation into South Florida anti-aging clinic accused of distributed performance-enhancing drugs to a number of professional baseball players.

docs.snippet: Despite his slight build, the Yankees’ Alfonso Soriano has consistently used one of the heaviest bats in baseball....
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite his slight build, the Yankees’ Alfonso Soriano has consistently used one of the heaviest bats in baseball.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees second baseman Alfonso Soriano, despite his slight frame, has for years preferred an unusually long and heavy bat; for Major League Baseball players, size of the bat is a matter of comfort.

headline.main: For Soriano, a Heavy Bat Has Always Felt Just Right
headline.print_headline: Soriano Still Swinging a Heavy Bat, Saying It Just Feels Right to Him

docs.abstract: George Scott, three-time All-Star who helped lead Boston Red Sox to American League pennant in 1967, dies at age 69.

docs.abstract: Profile of Ken Harrelson, former professional baseball player and longtime Chicago White Sox announcer who has taken on the increasingly entrenched world of statistical analysis known as sabermetrics; Harrelson is critical of the numerical movement in baseball and calls its rise 'the biggest joke I've ever seen.'

headline.main: For Baseball Old-Timer, Numbers Aren’t the Story
